N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4000.1 - Functions of the board

State Regulations
(a) Although the primary function of the State Mediation Board is to take all steps
which will effectively and expeditiously carry out the policy of the New York

State Legislature and maintain industrial peace through mediation as set forth
in article 21 of the State Labor Law, the board has an additional
function--that of arbitration. (b) The services of the board will be provided to resolve disputes between an
employer and a labor organization in the following situations: (1)

Where there is a collective bargaining
agreement containing an arbitration clause and the State Mediation Board is
named as the arbitration agency, or
(2)

The parties by an agreement in writing
submit a dispute or grievance to the board for arbitration. (c) The maintenance of industrial
peace is the watchword of the State Mediation Board, and it strives to
accomplish this end through the resolution of disputes through mediation and
arbitration at the voluntary request of the parties to the
dispute. Notes
